Patient with MONOCLONAL GAMMOPATHY -> CBC, Chemistry profile, SPEP, UPEP, IEP, Quantitative immunoglobulins, Free light chain assay, B2-Microglobulin (B2M), Bone survey, Bone marrow aspirate -> Increased IgG, A, D, E, and/or Bence Jones protein -> No lytic lesions, Bone marrow ≥10% plasma cells, M component often >2.5 g/dl, +Abnormal UPEP <2 g/dl, No systemic signs or symptoms of disease, Hemoglobin ≥10.5 g/dl, Corrected Ca²⁺ <11.5 -> Asymptomatic multiple myeloma -> Low-risk features -> Follow up

leaf: Consider: Lymph node biopsy to rule out more aggressive lymphoma or transformation
